intro: Anthoshorea harmandii, commonly known as the Harmand's anthoshorea, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Meliaceae, which includes mahogany and other tropical trees. The plant is characterized by its compound leaves and small, fragrant flowers that bloom in clusters. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments within tropical forests. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
